alert.note: Alert for Gonzales; Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 06 at 3:57PM CDT until April 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Gonzales County in south central Texas... Northwestern Karnes County in south central Texas... Southeastern Wilson County in south central Texas... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 357 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gonzales, Kosciusko, Nixon, Falls City, Smiley, Pandora, Gillett, Cestohowa, Bebe, Wrightsboro, Monthalia, Cost, Oak Forest, Paweleville, Pana Maria and Hobson. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cibolo Creek, Brushy Creek, Elm Creek, Peach Creek, Mulifest Creek, Clemens Creek, Sandies Creek, Board Branch, Answorth Branch, Las Moras Creek, Liberty Creek, O`Neal Creek, Shockley Creek, Clear Fork Creek, North Fork Smith Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Willow Creek, Mustang Creek, Rhymes Creek, Lake Slough, Cow Creek, Ecleto Creek, Panna Maria Creek, Marcelinas Creek, Murray Branch, Jack Pump Creek, San Antonio River, Kerr Creek, Cooper Creek, Sugar Creek, Tinsley Creek, Jacobs Creek, Conquista Creek, Five Mile Creek, Denton Creek, Mound Creek, Cross Timber Creek, Dry Creek, Salty Creek, Smith Creek, Panther Branch, Dry Ecleto Creek, San Marcos River, Guadalupe River, Yow Branch, Tally Branch and Elm Slough. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
